nodes.bodyText:
I agree with Andrew here, the use of the Optional makes the intent of the line slightly clearer. Though by convention Strimzi as a project does tend to use null checks over optionals...
Perhaps one of the other maintainers has an opinion on this, @ppatierno ?
TBH, I'm probably more old school. The original code from @stanlyDoge is much easier to read for me. But I do not have a problem if he changes it according to your suggestion.
I am old school as @scholzj and I agree with him that the actual code is more readable and understandable.
It does seems strange to me that the processing of the current and desired statuses is not the same before the comparison.

* @return true when the diffed statuses match
Might be a slight improvement
Is this something we should also use in other places where we use the JsonDiff?
I do not think that is necessary. Of course, the diff is better human-readable, if it contains multiple keys.

I guess I don't fully understand why this line is necessary. I can see how changes to the ordering of the array mirrorMaker2Status.getConnectors() would affect the jsondiff (and hence why the comparator is the solution to that), but IIUC the jsondiff shouldn't care about the order of maps (see RFC6902).
It does not have any functional impact. It just makes debug log more readable for a human being.
Please can we add a comment to say that.

I wonder if the name properly describes what it does. All it compares is the names of the connectors. Not the connectors them self - for example their settings etc. If nothing else, this should have some javadoc describing what it does in more detail.
Maybe we could also move the class to the end of the file? I find it a bit weird to have it in the middle.
